intro: Telis caelesyriaca, commonly known as the Eastern Skyflower, is a perennial herb native to the temperate regions of Eastern Europe. It features slender, upright stems that can grow up to 60 centimeters in height, adorned with lance-shaped leaves that have a slightly hairy texture. The plant produces clusters of small, white to pale blue flowers during the late spring and early summer months. Its root system is fibrous and often used in traditional herbal medicine for its purported calming effects. Telis caelesyriaca thrives in well-drained soil and partial to full sunlight, making it a suitable choice for garden cultivation.
